faq.label: FAQ
faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: Is Sri Lanka safe to travel?
faq.a1: Yes. Sri Lanka is a welcoming and generally safe destination for international travellers. We provide 24/7 support and our local guides are experienced in ensuring your safety throughout your journey.
faq.q2: When is the best time to visit Sri Lanka?
faq.a2: Sri Lanka has two monsoon seasons affecting different coasts. December–April is ideal for the west & south coast. May–September is best for the east coast. The Cultural Triangle is enjoyable year-round.
faq.q3: Do I need a visa to visit Sri Lanka?
faq.a3: UK, EU and most Western passport holders require an Electronic Travel Authorisation (ETA). It can be obtained online before travel and typically costs around $50 USD.
faq.q4: How much does a private 2-week tour cost?
faq.a4: Our private tours typically range from £2,500–£6,000+ per couple (excluding flights) depending on accommodation tier and inclusions. We offer transparent quotes with no hidden fees.
faq.q5: What is included in your private tours?
faq.a5: All our tours include a dedicated private chauffeur-guide, accommodation as specified, entrance fees to attractions, and 24/7 support. We can also arrange meals, activities, and transfers.

destinations_page.sigiriya_overview: Rising 200 metres above the surrounding plains, Sigiriya is Sri Lanka's most iconic landmark. This ancient rock fortress was built in the 5th century by King Kashyapa and features extraordinary frescoes, water gardens, and panoramic views across the jungle.
destinations_page.kandy_overview: Kandy is Sri Lanka's last royal capital — a hillside city of temples, spice markets, and cool mountain air. Home to the Sacred Temple of the Tooth Relic, the city is a living cultural museum surrounded by tea country.
destinations_page.ella_overview: Ella is a small mountain town in the heart of Sri Lanka's tea country, famous for stunning viewpoints, the iconic Nine Arch Bridge, and the world's most scenic train journey. It's a favourite for hikers and nature lovers.
destinations_page.galle_overview: Galle is a UNESCO World Heritage Site on Sri Lanka's southern coast. Its 17th-century Dutch colonial fort encloses cobblestone streets, boutique hotels, independent galleries, and excellent restaurants.
destinations_page.yala_overview: Yala National Park is Sri Lanka's most visited and second largest national park. It supports the highest density of leopards in the world and is home to elephants, sloth bears, crocodiles, and hundreds of bird species.

faq.q1: Is Sri Lanka good for Ayurveda retreats?
faq.a1: Absolutely. Sri Lanka shares the birthplace of Ayurveda with India but offers a distinctively softer, more tropical, and incredibly hospitable approach to wellness, often set against pristine beaches or lush jungles.
faq.q2: What is the best time to visit Sri Lanka for wellness?
faq.a2: Sri Lanka is a year-round destination. The South/West coasts are best from November to April, while the East coast is perfect from May to September. For hill country retreats, the weather is pleasant all year.
faq.q3: Is Sri Lanka safe for solo female travelers?
faq.a3: Yes, Sri Lanka is highly regarded as a safe destination for solo female travelers. Zelenso provides dedicated private chauffeurs and carefully vets all wellness resorts for utmost security and comfort.
faq.q4: Do I need a visa for Sri Lanka from the UK, Germany, or France?
faq.a4: Yes, but it is a simple process. Travelers from these countries can easily apply for an Electronic Travel Authorization (ETA) online before arrival.
